title: Sheffield shooting: First picture of young man shot dead in broad daylight 'on way to family celebration'
text:
The victim of the shooting has been named locally as Aseel Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
This is the first picture of a young Mercedes driver who was shot dead in broad daylight on a street in Sheffield. 
The 23-year-old victim - named locally as Aseel - has been described by friends as a "decent guy" who was "always approachable". 
He was reportedly hit in the chest in the city's Upperthorpe area while on the way to a family celebration at about 1.35pm yesterday. 
A number of his friends took to Facebook to post tributes. 
One girl, using the name Princess Mina, posted a picture of Aseel and added: “Cannot believe i’m not gonna see you again. 
"Will never forget him, I ways use to see him in the area. He was a top lad.” Read More Sheffield shooting: Young 'Mercedes driver' dies after being shot in chest in street Police tape surround a black Mercedes car (Photo: PA) 
Shanice Francis-edge added: “It brings a tear to my eye to know that someone who you’ve known for so many years to get taken from his world in the cruelest way possible. I still don't believe it! Such a funny guy, too many memories! “ 
People living in the area say the victim was either in, or close to, a black Mercedes he had been driving when he was shot. 
The man was taken to hospital as large numbers of police, including armed officers, arrived in the area. He died soon after. 
Police have now launched an investigation into the incident, and are urging anyone with information about it to contact them. Armed police were at the scene (Photo: PA) A 23-year-old man died after the shooting (Photo: PA) 
The shooting took place on Daniel Hill, between the Upperthorpe and Walkley areas. 
They claimed relatives had been gathering for a family celebration when the man was gunned down. Many came out of the house to try to help him after hearing the incident, neighbours said. Read More Police at the scene in Daniel Hill (Photo: PA) The area was sealed off (Photo: PA) 
After police officers established a cordon around the Mercedes on Daniel Hill, more relatives arrived in the street, clearly distraught. 
A South Yorkshire Police spokeswoman said: "A 23-year-old man has died following a reported shooting on Daniel Hill, Walkley, Sheffield, this afternoon. 
"At around 1.35pm police were called to Daniel Hill following reports that a man had been shot. 
"The 23-year-old man was taken to Northern General Hospital with a suspected gunshot wound. He died a short time later. 
"Police are currently investigating the incident and anyone who was in the area at the time, or has information about the incident is urged to contact police on 101 quoting incident number 571 of 18 February." 
On Saturday afternoon a section of Daniel Hill was sealed off either side of the Mercedes car, which had its front windows open and was parked by the side of the road. 
Police guarding the north end of the cordon were carrying guns. Read More Double murderer bludgeoned two pals to death in garden and was caught after neighbour spotted body over garden fence 
A large number of officers and forensic examiners were also at the southern end, near the commercial centre of Upperthorpe, where a number of shops and cafes are located. 
There have been a spate of shootings in Sheffield in recent weeks, although all the previous incidents have been in the north of the city and none have been close to the Upperthorpe area. 
People watching the police activity said they could not remember another shooting in the area. 
One man said: "Upperthorpe has had its problems but it's been better recently. I've never heard of a shooting here. I'm shocked." 
On Monday, a 25-year-old man was seriously injured when he was shot in the street in the Shiregreen area of Sheffield. 
Earlier this month, a pensioner couple were shocked when shots were fired through their living room window in the Southey Green area of the city - an incident that police said was almost certainly a case of a gunman getting the wrong house. 
These incidents followed two more in January which both involved shots being fired at houses in the same street in High Green, Sheffield. Like us on Facebook
